sen.j: 五日市憲法（いつかいちけんぽう）は、明治時代初期に作られた私擬憲法の一つ。
sen.e: The Itsukaichi Constitution is one of the constitution drafts which were made at the beginning of Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 五日市憲法ーYahoo百科事典、 私擬ー出典；Infoseek和英
sen.e: The Itsukaichi Constitution is one of the constitution drafts which were made at the beginning of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: Meiji→the Meiji に修正しました。
sen.e: The Itsukaichi Constitution is one of the constitution drafts which were made at the beginning of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 別名を日本帝国憲法という。
sen.e: It is given a sobriquet "the Japanese Imperial Constitution."
sen.cmt: 大日本帝国憲法（The Constitution of the Empire of Japan）との区別をつけるように訳しました。
sen.e: It is given a sobriquet "the Japanese Imperial Constitution."
It is given a sobriquet "the Japanese Imperial Constitution."

sen.j: 全204条からなり、そのうち150条を基本的人権について触れ、国民の権利保障に重きをおいたものである。
sen.e: The constitution draft consists of 204 Articles in total, 150 Articles which mention basic human rights; this shows that the constitution draft emphasizes the assurance of civil rights.
The constitution draft consists of 204 Articles in total and 150 Articles which mention basic human rights put emphasis on the assurance of civil rights.
sen.cmt: and を加え、this shows～の部分をput emphasis on～としました。
sen.e: The constitution draft consists of 204 Articles in total and 150 Articles which mention basic human rights put emphasis on the assurance of civil rights.

sen.j: 五日市学芸講談会のうち１人である千葉卓三郎が1881年に起草したとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that one of the members of the Itsukaichi Learning and Debating Society, Takusaburo CHIBA made the draft in 1881.
sen.cmt: 「五日市学芸講談会」出典；http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=goYOPty1L1oC&pg=PA79&lpg=PA79&dq=chiba+takusaburo&source=bl&ots=EWQ3az6TBW&sig=0uVQNElHBOL6bGCRtrM2FWOEcU0&hl=en&ei=ZvlQTKj3HpCmvQOYsNT6Bg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBcQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=chiba%20takusaburo&f=false、千葉卓三郎－Yahoo百科辞典、学芸－出典；Infoseek和英
sen.e: It is believed that one of the members of the Itsukaichi Learning and Debating Society, Takusaburo CHIBA made the draft in 1881.
It is believed that one of the members of the Itsukaichi Learning and Debating Society, Takusaburo CHIBA made the draft in 1881.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）、色川大吉によって東京都西多摩郡五日市町 (東京都)（現あきる野市）の深沢家土蔵から発見された。
sen.e: The draft was found by Daikichi IROKAWA in the earthen storehouse (storehouse with thick earth and mortar walls) of FUKAZAWA family in Itsukaichi Town, West Tama District, Tokyo (the present Akiruno City, Tokyo) in 1968.

The draft was found by Daikichi IROKAWA in the earthen storehouse (storehouse with thick earth and mortar walls) of the Fukazawa family in Itsukaichi Town, West Tama District, Tokyo (the present Akiruno City, Tokyo) in 1968.
sen.cmt: FUKAZAWA→the Fukazawa に修正しました。
sen.e: The draft was found by Daikichi IROKAWA in the earthen storehouse (storehouse with thick earth and mortar walls) of the Fukazawa family in Itsukaichi Town, West Tama District, Tokyo (the present Akiruno City, Tokyo) in 1968.

sen.j: 国民の権利などについて、当時としては画期的な内容が含まれ、現日本国憲法に近い内容も見られる。
sen.e: The draft contains some epoch-making contents for the period, such as civil rights, which has some affinities with the present constitution of Japan.
The draft contains some epoch-making contents for the period, such as civil rights, which has some affinities with the present constitution of Japan.
The draft contains some epoch-making contents for the period, such as civil rights, which has some affinities with the present constitution of Japan.

sen.j: 五日市憲法は東京都の有形文化財（古文書）に、深沢家屋敷跡（土蔵などが残る）は史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The Itsukaichi Constitution is recorded as one of the ancient documents of the tangible cultural assets of Tokyo, and the place where the residence of Fukawaza family used to be located (where the earthen storehouse still remains) is designated as one of the ancient sites.

The Itsukaichi Constitution is recorded as one of the ancient documents of the tangible cultural assets of Tokyo, and the place where the residence of the Fukawaza family used to be located (where the earthen storehouse still remains) is designated as one of the ancient sites.

The Itsukaichi Constitution is recorded as one of the ancient documents of the tangible cultural assets of Tokyo, and the place where the residence of the Fukawaza family used to be located (where the earthen storehouse still remains) is designated as one of the ancient sites.

sen.j: 前者は東京経済大学に保管されていたが、現在はあきる野市の中央図書館に移管された。
sen.e: The Itsukaichi Constitution used to be kept in Tokyo Keizai University (Tokyo Economy University); however, it was transferred to the Akiruno City central library and is now maintained there.
The Itsukaichi Constitution used to be kept in Tokyo Keizai University; however, it was transferred to the Akiruno City central library and is now maintained there.
The Itsukaichi Constitution used to be kept in Tokyo Keizai University; however, it was transferred to the Akiruno City central library and is now maintained there.
